Activity: Arrive at work, log into the computer, and check emails for any urgent updates or information regarding EHR implementation and influenza vaccination protocols. Also, browse some health-related websites for 15 minutes.

Review the daily patient schedule and prioritize patient assessments based on urgency and scheduled appointments. Prepare my workstation with necessary supplies including assessment tools, vaccination supplies, and EHR access.

Begin patient assessments. Focus on the first scheduled patient, ensuring a thorough review of their medical history, current symptoms, and any relevant allergies. Ask open-ended questions to encourage the patient to share any concerns.

Accurately document all patient assessment findings directly into the EHR system. Pay close attention to detail and ensure all fields are completed correctly. Double-check for any errors or omissions before saving the entry.
Administer influenza vaccination to a patient according to established protocols. Verify patient identity, allergies, and contraindications before administering the vaccine.

Document the influenza vaccination details in the EHR system, including the date, time, vaccine type, lot number, and administration site. Provide the patient with post-vaccination instructions and address any concerns.
Continue patient assessments and data entry into the EHR system for scheduled patients. Maintain a patient-centered approach, providing compassionate care and addressing individual needs.
Lunch Break. Catch up with @RN-1 and @RN-3 in the break room, discuss patient cases, and share experiences with the new EHR system.
Review the hospital's policy on vaccine handling and administration. Pay special attention to the proper storage of the influenza vaccine.
Continue with patient assessment and EHR data entry. If there's time, read some articles on nursing and art.
Communicate with @clinlead-1 regarding patient assessments that requires further actions or discussion.
Prepare end-of-day report of the work progress and create a to-do list for tomorrow.
Check and respond to the emails.
